_header: God that died upon a tree
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 490; prose chronicles ending at 1419 give only a prose paraphrase; those continuing to 1430 give fuller prose paraphrase with last part in verse; only complete text is London, British Library Cotton Galba E.VIII; each MS shows considerable variants
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library e Musaeo 63 (SC 3652): see Oxford, Bodleian Library e Musaeo 124 (SC 3562); San Marino, CA, Henry Huntington Library HM 131 [olim Buccleuch, Quaritch Cats. 303, 304]: see Urbana, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign 116 [olim Duke of Buccleuch; olim Lord Amherst of Hackney; olim Harmsworth, Sotheby Sale Oct. 15, 1945, lot 1951].
_description: The Siege of Rouen, ascribed to John Page, sometimes inserted into the prose Brut — in couplets

BodeMus124.First Lines:
God that deyede vppon the rode treAnd bouȝt vs alle with hys
                    blode so fre…
BodeMus124.Last Lines:
…ffor þow þe stormes were neuere so greteDrye vnder
                    hede þey myghte þer trede
BodeMus124.Note: Lines 1-946 only; ends imperfectly due to loss of folio.
BodeMus124.Editions:
Conybeare,  John Josias. 
             “Poem, entitled The Siege of Rouen: written in the Reign of Henry the
                Fifth.” 
             Archaelogia
         21 (1827): 43-78: 48-78.

OxfBal354.First Lines:
God that dyed vpon a tree& bowghte vs with his blode so
                    free…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…That for vs dyed vpon a treSay we all amen for
                    Charyte
OxfBal354.Attributed Title:
The Siege / of Rone (p. 261); Here endith þe Sege of Rone (p.
                    282)
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

CULHh69.First Lines:
And more they shulde vndertakeA castell for oure d kyng
                    doo make…
CULHh69.Last Lines:
…That for vs died vpon a treAmen sey we all for
                    charitee

CamTCC1413.First Lines:
…And more thei shall vndertakeA Castell for oure kyng to
                    make…
CamTCC1413.Last Lines:
…þat for vs deied vpon a treeAmen say we all for
                    charite

BLAdd27879.Note: Badly damaged; lines 1-119; 176-202, 226-85, 349-76 of the copy in London,  British Library Egerton 1995.
BLAdd27879.Editions:
Hales,  John Wesley,  and  Frederick James Furnivall, eds.  
             Bishop Percy’s Folio Manuscript: Ballads and Romances.
         3 vols. London: Trübner, 1867-68: 3.533.

BlCottGalEVIII.First Lines:
And at Warwike that Erle so freWe callid ofte it wold not
                    be…
BlCottGalEVIII.Last Lines:
…That for vs deid vpon atreeAmen sey we alle pur
                    charite

BLEge1995.First Lines:
GOd that dyde a pon A treAnd bought vs with hys blode soo
                    fre…
BLEge1995.Last Lines:
…That for vs dyde vppon a treeSay amen for Charyte.
                    Amen
BLEge1995.Editions:
Gairdner,  James,
                        ed.  
             Historical Collections of a Citizen of London.
Camden Society
         n.s. 17 (1876): 1.
Brie,  Friedrich,
                        ed.  
             The Brut, or the Chronicles of England.
EETS
         o.s. 131 (1906), 136 (1908); repr. 1987: 404.
Huscher,  Herbert,
                        ed.  
             John Page’s Siege of Rouen.
Kölner Anglistische Arbeiten
         1. Leipzig: Tauchnitz, 1927: 1.138 (crit. ed.).

BLHar266.First Lines:
…ffor he ys mercyfull yn syȝtAnd askyþe nothyng but
                    hys ryȝt…
BLHar266.Last Lines:
…vnto þat way god ham wyssethat they mowe come to hys
                    blysse
BLHar266.Note:
Couplets occasionally inserted into prose narrative account of the
                    siege; last cited couplet followed by ‘Amen’ (f. 142).
BLHar266.Attributed Title:
A verie large Chronicle from the beginning of E. I perfect to anno quo H. 6
                    (added by sixteenth-century hand to top margin, f. 1)

BLHar753.First Lines: Atte Warwyk þe erle so freWe cleped after It wold not be…
BLHar753.Last Lines: …þat for vs dyed on a treAmen seyde all for charitee
BLHar753.Note:
Written as prose, often with one couplet taking up a single line of the manuscript. Twentieth-century transcript is London,  British Library Egerton 2257, ff. 17-19 (82
                    lines only).

BLHar2256.First Lines: And at Warwik þat Erle so freWe callid ofte it wold not be…
BLHar2256.Last Lines: …þat for vs deide vpon a treAmen sey we alle pur cherite
BLHar2256.Note: Written as verse though inserted in prose Brut, in two columns.
BLHar2256.Editions:
Madden,  Frederick. 
             “Old English Poems on the Siege of Rouen, AD 1418.” 
             Archaelogia
         22 (1829): 350-98: 361 (collated with London,  British Library Harley 753).

Lam331.First Lines:
Atte Warwick þe erle so freWe called oft it wold not
                    be…
Lam331.Last Lines:
…Þat for vs dide on a treeAmen seid all for
                    charitee

ChicagoUL254.First Lines:
…And at Warwyk þe Erle so freWe called ofte it wolde nat
                    beAnd at the Erle Marchall we wereþere was no wyght þat
                    wolde vs answere…
ChicagoUL254.Last Lines:
…for a worde wronge out of wardemyght make you to fare full
                    hardeTherfore of wordes loke ye be wiseAnd sey no
                    thing…
ChicagoUL254.Note:
Lines 637-773 only: Begins and ends imperfectly; verse begins without
                    indication in midst of prose account of the siege, ends imperfectly at end of
                    page (further folios missing?); written as prose in the prose Brut. 68 x
                    2 (last couplet incomplete).

Urbana116.First Lines:
…Atte Warwyk the erle so ffreWe callid ofte it wolde nat
                    beAnd at þe erle Marchall we werethere was no wyght þat
                    wolde vs answere…
Urbana116.Last Lines:
…To blysse Cryst you bryngeþat for vs deyde on a
                    treAmen seyde Alle ffor charyte
Urbana116.Note:
Written as prose; for provenance, see De Ricci (1906)
XDe Ricci,  Seymour. 
             A Handlist of a Collection of Books and Manuscripts Belonging
                to…Lord Amherst of Hackney.
         Cambridge: University Press, 1906, 357
                    (MS 58).
